website_summaries.verdict: Nice kettle with a Bakelite handle that's easy on the hands.
pros: Large opening that makes filling and pouring a breeze
cons: Interior lining may peel, leave debris floating in the water
Indicator of water level hard to see

customer_reviews.title: Inside is plastic. On the bottom is stainless, ...
customer_reviews.text: Inside is plastic. On the bottom is stainless, but everything else, inside, is plastic. Two kinds of plastic. Both NOT BPA free. Very carefully these facts were omitted in the description. Packed it, shipped back.
customer_reviews.author: Dragoise

customer_reviews.title: Pins fall out and it leaks
customer_reviews.text: Was ok for a few months, then one of the pins started falling out of the handle and it leaks around the spout when you pour. Very disappointed, My old tea kettle lasted many years and never leaked or lost a pin.
customer_reviews.author: Pheedaz

customer_reviews.title: Nice, large stainless steel tea kettle.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a month ago. Lots of use so far, I brew Lipton tea to make a gallon of sweet tea. Works great, bigger then expected, which is fine since I brew large batches of tea. For some reason the picture shown looked like kettle had a black line down it, did not, all stainless steel, it's fine, still looks good in my kitchen. I don't ever need it to whistle, but did once to hear sound, loud enough, but not ear piercing. I did A lot of research before choosing this one, so far I'm very happy with my decision.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Cummins

customer_reviews.title: Be aware, it may not brand new
customer_reviews.text: Item was thrown into box without any wrappings. Instructions manuals are also not covered with wrapping. Cord are tied unevenly. It looks obviously used. Very disappointed for the conditions. Who would trust using water boiled by this dirty kettle.
customer_reviews.author: Sayuri Olse

customer_reviews.title: DESIGNED POORLY
customer_reviews.text: This kettle's handle gets too hot to hold after it boils. Its too hot even a few minutes later. Its annoying to have to use a pot holder to pour a cup of hotwater. I expected more from TFAL and regret buying it. I don't think keeping the handle cool is rocket science since I have owned many kettles and never seen something so stupid on any other's I have owned. I also noticed many of these other reviews are not for this TFAL Stovetop tea kettle and I am left to wonder if this is a trick the seller uses to change the ratings of a poorly designed product.
customer_reviews.author: Caren Miller

customer_reviews.title: The whistle is super loud which is good because there are times I ...
customer_reviews.text: The big base means it catches all of the heat when our biggest gas ring is on full, so it boils relatively quickly. The whistle is super loud which is good because there are times I forget I'm boiling water and need reminding! It's easy to fill it through the spout you can hold the kettle and open the spout lid with one hand whilst using the other hand to operate the tap. It discoloured very quickly, after a few uses, and always looks a little dirty because the shiny finish really shows up finger prints, splashes and water stains.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Leaking from the bottom on first use.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to take to work because it is compact and doesn’t get too hot to touch. Glad I decided to run a couple of cycles through at home. I filled it up to a 1 L mark and turned it on. It seemed fine until it reached almost boiling, that’s when the water started leaking all around the bottom, it wasn’t just a drip - it was pouring. I quickly pulled the plug. Returning and will be buying a different kettle. Someone could have easily gotten electrocuted with the amount of water coming out, I’m glad I was closely watching it.
customer_reviews.author: Lenka.Koshka

customer_reviews.title: LOOK AT THIS! Scary!!!
customer_reviews.text: Anyone else’s do this!!?? WTH? I will be returning! It’s going to break my stove!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Sweetland

customer_reviews.title: Nice Looking Tea Kettle
customer_reviews.text: Love it so far. Great quality. Took a long time researching tea kettles and despite all the reviews and issues, some rust reported, I went ahead and purchased this one. It is reasonable for the price. It appears exactly as shown. I found nothing wrong with the quality. I will update this later if I find anything wrong with the kettle. Great price. Matches other stainless steel appliances and kitchen items. Wanted to have a simple kettle so we will see how it holds up to the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: SMH

customer_reviews.title: Ignore bad reviews, great kettle!
customer_reviews.text: I’m partial to T-fal products because they have always been the highest quality cookware in my kitchen. I couldn’t understand how people had negative things to say about this product. Maybe Amazon listing wars? — where companies fight dirty to get the higher placement in search results, even leaving fake negative reviews. Or maybe there were at one time quality control issues. Whatever the reason, I think this is a quality product and well-made. I always update my reviews when something breaks, so if this thing has any problems, I will definitely be back here to correct my rating.
customer_reviews.author: odin

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: First time in my life I owned a tea kettle - as I almost burned my apartment down forgetting about a pot on the stove that I was boiling water in. I wanted something simple that performs the basic function of alerting me to attend to it when I walk away from the stove. I also wanted to make sure the handle is not hot to the touch when picking it up. This checked both boxes. It seems sturdy and likely to last a while.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm2

customer_reviews.title: Awesome electric kettle. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of T-fal products, and this electric kettle is no exception. You can boil and heat the water within 1-2 minutes (depending on the amount you pour in). Build quality is sturdy and feels like a quality product. I shopped around at other similar items, but ultimately I settled on purchasing T-fal because they usually make high quality products. I have had this kettle for about 1 year now and it has been working flawlessly on a daily basis, so this is definitely a durable kettle. My only complaint is that there are no other color options available.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Handle gets extremely hot
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, but the handle gets too hot when the water boils.
customer_reviews.author: LSM

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing so far
customer_reviews.text: I first found T-fal as I was buying supplies and cookware for my first apartment/kitchen on my own, and they’ve never disappointed - this teapot included. Incredibly easy to clean, no odd smells like my last teapot had, and I can let water sit in it with no problems until I heat it up for my next cup. Handle doesn’t get hot (I have an electric stove, so I can’t speak to whether that will hold true with gas stoves), and the teapot’s design allows for water to heat very quickly so I never have to wait long for my tea. Definitely recommend this brand as a whole.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Didn't like this one at all. DOA.
customer_reviews.text: This product was DOA. Amazon refunded the purchase and I bought a Maxware Trading Inc pot. This product was very cheaply constructed and I didn't feel like it was a safe product so I didn't want to try another one of these.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sible

customer_reviews.title: No problems with leaking or anything like that. It heats fairly quickly
customer_reviews.text: No problems with leaking or anything like that. It heats fairly quickly. The "On" light is a little hard to see. I've not played around with the temperature controls, so I can't vouch for that. This kettle has a nice wide top for refilling, and the green tab on the top makes it super easy to open the kettle. Nice design at a good price
customer_reviews.author: Karen Phelps

customer_reviews.title: poor materials
customer_reviews.text: After a very short period of time, under normal use, the hard plastic cover of the spout melted.
customer_reviews.author: James C Franson

customer_reviews.title: Mixed bag, but heats quickly
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE how quickly this heats up and even boils water. I even use it to boil the water that I then add to a pot in order to make Ramen noodles. However, I had hoped that the low setting would make water that would make hot chocolate that was of instantly-drinkable temperature. Far from it! I think the low temperature made the water even hotter than the highest setting. I wish I had realized that the markings on the window would be in liters.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Leinberger

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Durable, Easy to Clean
customer_reviews.text: We have had our kettle for six years now, and it has not skipped a beat in our kitchen. We use it for tea, coffee, oatmeal, and anything else we need a quick hot cup of water. The unit is very easy to clean, simple controls, and has put up with regular use. Some of the markings have worn off over time and cleaning, but everything otherwise works as new. If you are not looking for a specific look or style and need something that just works - grab one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Helgestad

customer_reviews.title: Had to throw away!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a little less than a year ago and I just revenuhad to throw it away. It started rusting on the inside. I really thought it wasn’t gonna rust because it had so many great reviews but to my disappointment, it rusted. I really like this tea pot too. Such a shame!
customer_reviews.author: stephanie maglietta

customer_reviews.title: Years of reliable use
customer_reviews.text: Got this June 2015 and it still works like new. At one point I dropped it and thought the knob had broken off. Nope. It had popped off & I just pushed it back on. It's stayed on ever since. This has functioned as expected. The reason I only gave it 4 stars is because the settings are very imprecise. Once you find your optimum setting, though, it heats water to that temp reliably. If you need to use a variety of temps, this may not be the best kettle for you. Then again, for the price you will not find anything better.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Inside rusts quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this August 2017, by February 2018 the inside is beginning to rust. I have tried to clean it but it does not clean off when scrubbed with steel soap pads. We have well water with no additives so this should not happen. Also, even half full it is very heavy and difficult to carry. I would not recommend this tea kettle at all.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Shrugs

customer_reviews.title: 3 quart whistling tea pot
customer_reviews.text: Love this tea pot, it does several things well. The wide bottom works on my large burner to get water hot fast. The whistle opens high and wide for easy filling through the spout. The whistle is loud enough to hear in the next room over the TV. Three quart capacity holds plenty of water to fill my half gallon ice tea carafe without boiling over or spitting out the whistle. My only dissatisfaction is the metal seems a bit thin
customer_reviews.author: J.T.M. Point Place

customer_reviews.title: Stylish, Functional, Durable!!
customer_reviews.text: Love the looks of this pot. Nice size opening so it's easy to clean. Heats water quickly. Turns off automatically. No noisy alarm when water is ready. Stylish and functional. I looked at a lot of electric teapots before selecting this pot. My prior method was boiling water in a pot. Really. No more spilled or splashing boiling water. AND, best of all I can put it on peninsula close to where we need the water instead of on the stove. Stows away easily close to where I use it
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Y

customer_reviews.title: Green tea dreams come true!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for small size, adjustable temperature, price, and good looks (reminds me of a fat sylized black-bird). Kettle is now 2 years old and still working great. I've always wanted to enjoy green tea but it was only by the direction of a friend that I understood low brewing temperature is key to avoiding bitterness. This little black bird kettle made my green tea dreams come true! 100% would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CHRISTINE SMITH

customer_reviews.title: Great for a trailer!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our trailer and it works great when we are plugged to power (sometimes we camp off the grid - this does not work for those occasions!) - it brews water in no time (two big teas worth of water) and has no weird taste/smell. It looks like it will last us a long time, but we've only had it for about a year and have used it maybe 10-15 times so far. The one we have in the home is bigger than this, but we really enjoy this size for the trailer.
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: Great for a few years, leaks at bottom & not BPA-free plastic
customer_reviews.text: Loved this electric kettle cuz of how fast it boils water, but after 4-5 yrs, it leaks at the bottom near the handle & this is quite dangerous as the electricity plate on the bottom gets wet. I also realized that this doesn't say BPA-free plastic, so perhaps it wasn't such a great buy after all. I guess it's time to move on & hopefully find a better.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Long Lasting Love
customer_reviews.text: I have had this thing for almost 7 years and it still warms water up quite fast. I like having the option of warming or boiling water. I use it every single day to make my coffee so it's had plenty of use. I like that it is very quiet compared to some other ones I've used. I also put filtered water in it and maybe once every six months clean the calcium deposits up. Honestly if it every does break I'd buy the exact same one.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria Tikalsky

customer_reviews.title: After 1 year of use - JUST as AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: I love this little kettle! We have been using it for a year with no issues whatsoever. It heats up fast and sometimes I do one batch right after another when we have a lot of tea drinkers at once. By the time I set up the first batch with tea, my second batch of hot water is already ready! This kettle has more than 2000 reviews and if it was me looking at that, I'd be skeptical of scam reviews for sheer numbers! So, with that being said, I want to add my review that this kettle is really worth 2000+ reviews. It's a quality product that is worth reviewing!
customer_reviews.author: Katya K

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Boils water in the matter of a couple ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Boils water in the matter of a couple of minutes. Awesome for tea. Even better when boiling water is needed for cooking! After 4 years, our filter needs to be replaced. Don't see them here on Amazon, but they're $0.70 on the T-fal site--- shipping is $9.99 though :(
customer_reviews.author: Robert T

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Previously, I gave a 2 stars to this product because it was defective as I found out through product reviews. I had to hold on to the "on" button for for the water to boil, I thought it was strange. So, I proceeded to return and replace and Amazon did a great job, no question just great customer service. I received the replacement product so fast, I would say 1 1/2 day and I was so happy because the new one works perfectly. Now, I love this product and it boil water so fast, no game.
customer_reviews.author: Reality-Actually

customer_reviews.title: Heats up quickly but LOUD
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for a few years now, 4-5 days each week, 2-4 times each day. About 50% of the time, it gets unbelievably loud. I purchased this for my office, so it's a little annoying in an office setting that it does this. It probably deserves three stars in all truthfulness, but if I left it that, I feel my review would get drowned out by all the others and I don't see many commenting on how loud it is.
customer_reviews.author: kineylikes

customer_reviews.title: A very well designed kettle.
customer_reviews.text: The kettle sits on a separate heating plate so that when you lift the kettle you don't have an accident when you need to use the hot water. There is a window to gauge how much water you have filled it with. The heat is variable so you can choose what temperature you need. It is easy to fill and pour with. It is lightweight, easy to pick up, and easy to pour with. The outside only gets warm, not too hot.
customer_reviews.author: James Sibley

customer_reviews.title: Base plate sloughs off unknown debris.
customer_reviews.text: I am submitting this for the second time since we have not heard from anyone!!!! We have controlled heating to be no higher than medium heat, but the bottom is sloughing off pieces of the metal or lining. We are not sure which. We are concerned that this might not be safe. We would like a refund or replacement if you can guarantee this won't happen again. Please let me know what you plan to do as far as a full refund or a replacement of this product!!!
customer_reviews.author: LaDonna

customer_reviews.title: Most durable water heater ever... 5+ years and still going
customer_reviews.text: I bought this during my college years to make tea in the morning. First time ever using an electric kettle. Still working for 5 years. Money well spent I'd say. Note: Bottle will accumulate calcium stains over time, just do some cleaning every 2 weeks by putting in vinegar and soak it overnight.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin

customer_reviews.title: Instructions say hand wash
customer_reviews.text: I specifically bought this tea kettle because it says it is dishwasher safe. The instructions say to hand wash. Otherwise, it is everything you would expect from a tea kettle.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon J

customer_reviews.title: No rust
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the STAINLESS STEEL stovetop kettle, not the plug up. Hard to find one under $30 but here it is! 3 full qts and perfect. Mine does not rust. I purposely left the inside damp and covered for a whole work day and nothing but dampness remained. I had tried two "stainless" 3qt kettles (under $30) from wayfair and they arrived with black tarnish on the inside which rusted right away when washed. Get this kettle b4 the price goes up.
customer_reviews.author: FLW

customer_reviews.title: Never thought I'd use it
customer_reviews.text: I got this for making instant coffee on a camping trip...nothing more. I haven't used a tea kettle in years...just too much time and hassle. The first time I used it I couldn't believe it took ice cold water to boiling in like a minute. Seriously. I brought it home and had a wild hair for tea.... Bingo, hot tea and honey in 2 minutes. I've since used it for instant oatmeal, cocoa, sauces, various cooking applications and lots more I hadn't even thought of. I see absolutely no reason why anyone would ever use a tea kettle again.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa K.

customer_reviews.title: Country of Origin
customer_reviews.text: I specifically ordered this T-fal (trying to pretend to be Tefal of course) kettle from the USA, and pay shipping costs in excess of the item's value, because I assumed that it must have been manufactured in the USA. Unfortunately I was wrong. It is just another kettle made in the PRC, which, probably like every other kettle I have bought which turned out to be made in the PRC, will rust within about three months although it is claimed to be stainless steel and rust-proof. IT SHOULD BE LAW THAT THE COUNTRY OF ORIGIN/MANUFACTURE IS DECLARED.
customer_reviews.author: Richard John Rundle Oats

customer_reviews.title: Dependable kettle
customer_reviews.text: I've had this kettle for 2 1/2 yrs and it still works as well as it did on day one. The water level markings have smeared, but that's the only discernible wear. Heats water well but stays safely cool to the touch. A bit pricey now compared to many others, but it has never failed me.
customer_reviews.author: AnimlLvr

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little kettle. It's perfect for my office, although it was bigger than I expected it to be. Helpful note: This kettle holds exactly one liter (4 cups) of water, and the fill line is on the outside. It may look like it can hold more water but if you do that, the water will boil over and out of the spout. But it's a good size, very rugged, easy to clean, and boils up to 4 cups in less than two minutes.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gillespie

customer_reviews.title: When You Wanna Be British...
customer_reviews.text: Have used this kettle for a couple years now, and I love it. I have very hard water, so every once in a while, the bottom gets scaly, and I'll run some vinegar through it. Just pour in enough vinegar to cover the bottom, then fill with water up to the lower fill line. Turn it on, then pour the hot vinegar water down the kitchen sink to freshen the drain. Two birds, one pot of vinegar... I use this kettle frequently. Makes such a big difference, making tea from the kettle versus microwaving a cup of water. The Brits have known this for years... A proper electric kettle like this one is a must for us Anglophiles!
customer_reviews.author: J. E.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!!
customer_reviews.text: This kettle is amazing!! Poured purified cold water straight from the fridge and turned it on to the highest temperature and it was boiling in an instant. Wish I timed it, but it was done before I had to hear the story on how my son won some weekly tournament on his xbox game. Now, if instant soup was that fast to cool down before he ate it would be 6 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Zana

customer_reviews.title: Best kettle
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this kettle almost daily for over a year. It's fast. It's easy to clean, and it doesn't drip when I pour. The temperature variance is great. Low for herbal. Middle for green. High for black tea. Being able to store extra cord in the base is a terrific feature too. The only bad thing is the window clouds over from steam, but I don't think there's a single way to avoid that. Steam's going to cover the inside of the pot--it's what steam does.
customer_reviews.author: ThatVulcanBitch

customer_reviews.title: Heats water very fast - faster than microwave
customer_reviews.text: Heats up water to varying degrees of hot very quickly. My kid got second degree burns from heating water in the microwave and spilling on his hand. I found out about this pot and liked that it heated water in less than 90 seconds - way faster than the microwave. Much easier. Excellent hot pot. I will start some water to boil on the stove for soup, and I add a pot of this boiled water, he stove pot then boils up much faster as well. Not just for tea!
customer_reviews.author: AnnieM

customer_reviews.title: Happy little tea pot
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this tea pot. It's replacing my old one of a different brand, that died a week ago, and if I'd known how much I would love this tea pot I'd have killed the other one sooner. It's fast, I love the temp control, it's easy to use, it turns off once the water is boiling so you don't accidentally boil all the water off and kill your tea pot, it is fantastic. It doesn't hold as much as my old one, but I never used that much water anyway. It's a nice amount of water, and it heats so fast that multiple batches wouldn't be a problem if they were even needed.
customer_reviews.author: The Ridleys

customer_reviews.title: All-around Winner
customer_reviews.text: Just what it's supposed to be, doing just what it's supposed to do. Cleans up in the dishwasher. Holds a good amount, strong but comfortable whistle, removable lid, stay-open spout. Handle doesn't get overly warm and begins to cool as soon as the burner is turned off. And it has a brushed finish! (Even though I thought the picture had a mirror polish.😏) A GREAT choice.
customer_reviews.author: L. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Boiling Water FAST
customer_reviews.text: I like the make Viet coffee which involves prepping the coffee before adding hot water. At first I was using a regular coffee maker to make the hot water. The first thing I would start is the coffee maker because by the time I prep the coffee the water would be hot. With this, making the hot water is now the LAST step! I cannot prepare the coffee before the hot water is ready. It literally takes under 30 seconds to have boiling hot water. I also use this with making noodles. Fill it to full and its boiling hot in half the time it takes on the stove. Finally a product that delivers!
customer_reviews.author: T. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is the coolest thing. I didn't realize I needed it but I'm so happy that I purchased it on a whim! It's a perfect size and I can make two large cups of tea out of one time filling it to the max level. The safety feature is working great so far. It's compact and looks just fine sitting on the counter by my coffee pot. I've used it 3 times and will update if anything drastic happens but so far I absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Get the best. You deserve it.  I did.
customer_reviews.text: It does everything, and with style. Beautiful appearance and color combination. Here are a few of the functional things I appreciate: (1) elongated pour spout to keep water from dripping while pouring; (2) temperature adjustment for light to super boil temperatures (burned tea leaves are nasty); (3) turns itself OFF - no irritating whistle; (4) wind-up cord under the base to keep things neat; (5) the handle is large, comfortable and never gets hot, and (6) appears to be rustproof. Since I'm a snob, the T-fal name appeals to me, and the Amazon price is half off it's original retail. Such a deal!
customer_reviews.author: AdoptAnOrphanDog

customer_reviews.title: I thought it was going to catch on fire
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a specific WHISTLE tea kettle, this item did NOT whistle, I could hear the water boiling inside and maybe thought it just took a while but then I waited and it started to smoke up all around and I started to freak. I thought it was going to catch on fire.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SUPER ENDORSEMENT
customer_reviews.text: Had this for 1.5 years now. Still running great, bottom of pot still no rust whatsoever. It's my favorite electric kettle at such a modest price. The design is great and there are 3 levels of heat adjustments. It boils water super fast like in 30 seconds. I love this kettle so much. I don't proactively endorse a lot of things but the fact that I'm back to review this project after buying it 1.5 years ago means it's awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Kradsinoda

customer_reviews.title: Good, but problems with spout
customer_reviews.text: i've ordered a this item a couple of times, so can attest that it works very well- however, in the last order that i placed for this item, the spout had actually broken off during the shipment, and had cracked into many smaller pieces i would recommend the company to take a look at the composition of the materials in the spout, because if it's breaking apart while during shipping, the material may be a little weak, and could be a big liability if it someday breaks while someone is trying to pour boiling water
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Brilliantly Designed and Easy to Use!
customer_reviews.text: Simple packaging, no fuss!! Just fill to the max line, plug in, turn knob for temp and click button on handle to boil!! It boils in a minute!! It has double insulated plastic so it is not hot to the touch!! It spins 360 on the hot plate!! It is so easy to use and handle!! No drips from the spout!! I use it at work every day!! I will be buying one for my house!! I'm so happy I bought this!! :DDD
customer_reviews.author: Carrie B.

customer_reviews.title: Heats up fast!
customer_reviews.text: Heats up water very quickly and the temperature control is good for different types of teas. The only problem is that small white dots have appeared on the metal base of my unit and i cant clean them off. It doesn't appear to affect anything, just a cosmetic oddity. Easy to pour and clean. The base is convenient too because the excess cord can be wrapped up in it and the kettle can rotate 360 degrees. All and all a great kettle.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: A fine and useful project.  Probably the quickest way to make yourself a good cup of tea -- at least in the U.S.A..
customer_reviews.text: After trying one of these in Germany and getting spoiled by having my tea water ready in a mere few seconds I decided to try an American version. Since our electricty here is only 120 Volts instead of 240 Volts as in most of Europe, this product only delivers 1750 Watts, instead of more than 3000 Watts as over there. Thus it is a bit slower coming to temperature, but probably no more than 30 seconds slower, and even we inveterately impatient Americans can probabloy learn to live with that!!
customer_reviews.author: William D. Fusfield

customer_reviews.title: Interior surface worries
customer_reviews.text: I bought this years ago, so I’ve been using it daily for years. I’ve noticed that bits of the interior silver coating have worn away and are in the water. I don’t know how long that’s been going on. An inner surface that does not corrode would be ideal. Ordering a new teapot for myself!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: The good: the kettle does not get hot when boiling ...
customer_reviews.text: This my third kettle, the previous two were stainless steel, so why the third one is not stainless steel, Well, couple of reasons. 1. when you heat the water the outside of the kettle is scalding hot, and burnt my hand couple of times, when I was half awake to make my tea. 2. too many dry water stains and high maintainance to clean 3. Large capacity, so took longer to boil on one preset temperature. The good: the kettle does not get hot when boiling water. No accidents I can control the temperature from luke warm to boiling hot. Separate base. easy to clean and looks very sleek on my black galaxy countertop. .
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: Large capacity for a small kettle
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend and I use this every morning. He heats up water for his french press and there is enough left over for me to make tea. It heats quickly and it's easy to adjust the tempurature. The handle stays cool and comfortably fits your hand. The power cord is a little shorter than I'd like but it's still long enough if you use a plug close to the counter top. I looked at a lot of kettles before ordering this one and I am pleased with my choice. It is much cheaper than others and it works great. Update: October 2017 Still use it almost everyday and still love it.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Knowles

customer_reviews.title: Lid Melted in Less Than 10 Uses
customer_reviews.text: You'd think the lid on the spout would be heat resistant. You'd think wrong. The plastic stopper that closes over the spout has bubbled and melted. This tea kettle is now headed for the junk heap after less than a dozen uses. What a waste!
customer_reviews.author: G. Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, fast heating, long lasting and attractive.
customer_reviews.text: I share a house with four others and we LOVE tea and coffee. We have used this for the past two or so years at least once daily and it still works great. Just recently the mesh filter on the spout started to break open, but our water is filtered already so we don't mind that too much, especially since it still works great and we've gotten plenty of use out of it in the past 2-3 years. Great quality, fast heating, and attractive display.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to quickly boil water for my french press. It was inexpensive, works super fast and the ability to lift it easily off the base was perfect. I find i use it more than I thought.....and now would be lost without it. Good: inexpensive, fast and small. Bad: not a thing Overall: If it broke a month from now I would buy the exact one again Still loving the little Tfal kettle, but I decided to purchase a larger kettle and I went with the Melita 1.7L. When it arrived I timed them both to see how fast to boiling hot water. Melita 1.7L Cordless kettle: 7:12:86 Tfal 1Liter: 2:47:81 Little Tfal kettle still ROCKS
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Use as directed and its a great buy
customer_reviews.text: Handle still gets hot and the sides get heat damage if used on a high heat gas flame. Other than that its perfect.
customer_reviews.author: SarahMillieGams

customer_reviews.title: Still works great!!!
customer_reviews.text: It’s been 4 yrs since we bought it and we use it everyday and it still works great!!! I’m so happy with this product and if you are debating, just get this one!!! Can’t go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: ami h

customer_reviews.title: Great little pot - very convenient!
customer_reviews.text: I bought my mother one of these in the larger size in white a year ago for Christmas. I paid $29.99 for it. Now they are over $200 each! Good gosh what is this world coming to? So...I bought this smaller one. Works just like Mom's just have to fill it with water more often and that's okay because we use it upstairs and use bottled water in it. Heats FAST and stays hot for a long time. When the water is at the temperature you set on the dial the button pops up and turns it off. No worry about forgetting to turn it off.
customer_reviews.author: Luvzhorses

customer_reviews.title: Water gets metallic taste.
customer_reviews.text: Washed it with soap and warm water as instructed - the kattle has strong metallic odor- and the water boiled inside it got metallic taste. Maybe I should have boilex the eater few times before using it... Don't know... Returning the kattle.
customer_reviews.author: Oren

customer_reviews.title: Spring loaded spout broke
customer_reviews.text: Barely over a month old and the spring mechanism that opens the spout broke. Expected WAY more from a $30 kettle that lasted less than a kettle from the dollar store.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Luke

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little kettle
customer_reviews.text: After being in Japan several times, I got spoiled by their awesome electric kettles. The most common brand I saw in most households was T-Fal. I wanted to bring a kettle back, but wasn’t possible to fit in my luggage. I’m glad that this exists here in the states. I don’t know what people are talking about that this kettle is bad or leaks. I’ve had this thing for over a year and have had ZERO problems with it. I Highly recommend this kettle!
customer_reviews.author: Steph S.

customer_reviews.title: Bring water to a boil quickly, secure on base and very easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: First time I've purchased a unit like this to heat water and I can't believe I didn't do it earlier. The unit is super easy to use and heats the water very quickly. If you are still heating water on the stove or in the microwave for tea, hot cocoa, etc... this is a far superior option. If you have kids who want to make their own cocoa this unit, while sure its still boiling water which carries its own risks, is better than having them around the stove or trying to remove hot water from a microwave and then pouring it into a cup - at least IMHO...
customer_reviews.author: Minnesota Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great kettle for price.
customer_reviews.text: Great little tea pot. I use it at work to make tea. I love that it has a temperature dial. I hate waiting for my tea to cool because I often forget about it in the process and by the time I remember it is cold. So this way I can heat it without over heating it. I have had a T-fal already at home for over a year and really like it so I went with the same company only a minor upgrade for work. Very happy with purchase. Would buy again. Looks nice, easy to use, holds large volume, heats quickly (about 1-2 minutes, quicker if it is not full).
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Six years in, still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't crazy about the design but decided to purchase it due to the good reviews. I've used it 2 to 3 times a day on average (if not more) and it's still going strong... after six years!
customer_reviews.author: Lu

customer_reviews.title: 2-Years of usage.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for 2 years. My whole family uses it everyday, several times a day. It has lasted so long and it is still in good condition. This has to be the most durable product i have ever invested in.
customer_reviews.author: hiba

customer_reviews.title: satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Gets about a pint of water to a scolding coffee in less than a minute. Couldn't care less about the temperature adjustments. Easy to set on the base with electrical contact, no fiddling with it, but a little worried about what if: that if I or my kids spill water on the contacts. One reviewer did answer that he did spill water into it without an incident. I would warn the kids, though, who are beginning to boil water on their own. My kitchen outlets are connected to GFCI outlet. This kettle is so easy to use I even forgot to push the on button.
customer_reviews.author: ventingisok

customer_reviews.title: fast and easy
customer_reviews.text: I only give this light usage, but I've been very satisfied, with no problems that others have reported. Mind I've only used filtered water with it... It was fast, easy to use, and reliably shut itself off. Anyway, this was a lifesaver when staying in a hotel room for several days and having no microwave or hotplate. Instead of the crappy or overpriced food and coffee that was available, pairing this various oatmeals and soups and noodles gave me some inexpensive choices and more control over my diet.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Parker

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Dependable
customer_reviews.text: This is the first electric kettle I've owned. My experience has always been with stove top kettles, but my wife is from overseas and has generally used the electric models. So, at her request, I bought one. What a pleasant surprise. Pros: Heats the water really fast - less than five minutes, every time This sucker gets used every day, usually several times per day - never a blip, and it's still going strong Low profile and easy to use Easy to clean Cons: None that I've found. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Tanggor

customer_reviews.title: Have had it for 4 years and I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to come on here because I bought this 4 years ago and I still love it and it’s going strong. I use it almost every day. Will definitely buy again and may buy as Christmas gifts this year.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda May

customer_reviews.title: Very Fast, very efficient. One reservation.
customer_reviews.text: I love it for making a pot of tea. It is far superior to heating water on the stove or in the microwave, but I find that it may be "tricky" in that you have to use a certain amount of finess in making some types of tea, especially loose tea. The pot brings water to a boil, and one rarely boils tea. If I were to ask for one additional feature, it would be a "keep warm" setting. The hot tea cools off quickly, once the heating cycle is done. You need to get it into a vacuum carafe quickly, or you will be on your way to iced tea.
customer_reviews.author: B. Marold

customer_reviews.title: Magnificent teapot!
customer_reviews.text: Great product; heats water super fast with no drips or spills. Washed with detergent upon unpacking and then it was off to the races boiling tea! No plastic aftertaste and the swivel base makes handling the pitcher a breeze. The automatic shut-off works perfectly; seconds after the water starts boiling. The temperature control also works well. Have used this daily since purchase a month ago and not had any problems. The T-Fal seems well-constructed and built to last. Great product at a great price. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Analytical Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a large capacity, stainless steel tea kettle and I LOVE this one! It is made of heavy duty material, the lid is double walled and has a nice handle, and the handle on the kettle stays cool and is ergonomically designed. This is a well-made, large kettle that I highly recommend to anyone looking for just that!
customer_reviews.author: Celeste Neff

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive electric kettle
customer_reviews.text: Great inexpensive electric kettle. Very quiet. Shuts off when the water boils. The on switch is on the handle. The lime green color is bright. Makes my hot water hot. Just perfect for my needs. I'd recommend it. ***** update- I purchased my kettle about 4 years ago. It has had daily use, and is still going. No problems except what would come with any kettle or coffee maker- hard water build up. I have returned at this time because I would like a larger kettle. I thought 4 cup kettle would be sufficient, but have since changed my mind.
customer_reviews.author: missmaddie

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good product for the price, although my one gripe is that the lowest setting is still quite hot. I like brewing high end imported white and green teas, and these teas often require a temperature of only around 140 F (60 C). At the lowest setting, this unit will heat the water still to well over 200 F (93 C). Still, consistent heating and looks very sleek, though I also do somewhat wish that I could have chosen an option other than neon green/yellow plastic on the knobs, switches, and spout.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H.

customer_reviews.title: Dead in 4 months, just outside of the return window
customer_reviews.text: This died after 4 months with very light use. It's outside of Amazon's return window and T-Fal's website support is a maze that's not going to get me anywhere. I wish we'd have stuck to better brands that have better build. We definitely got what we paid for in this instance.
customer_reviews.author: Madeleine Howard

customer_reviews.title: Great mini kettle
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little kettle, boils quickly and temperature adjustment is a nice feature. I have it set down on minimum and and it is great for my cups of green tea. This kettle will heat up approx 3 mugs of water at a time. It is small enough to fill from my refrigerators water filter. I cleaned it with vinegar before first using it and the water tastes great, there is no chemical or plastic taste present.
customer_reviews.author: Neil C

customer_reviews.title: Looked at many and glad I opted for the T-Fal kettle
customer_reviews.text: Looked at many and glad I opted for the T-Fal kettle. I like using a french press for making coffee but was uncertain if one of these electric kettles would get the water hot enough. Not only does it get the water heated to a suitable temperature for my coffee, it does so way faster than heating water in a kettle. The smaller size of this kettle is perfect for me. I make one good sized mug and poor hot water to heat my mug before adding coffee from the french press. I have used it for about 2 months now and have had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: RJK

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty frustrating to say the least
customer_reviews.text: Very dissapointed. In order to heat 0.5 L plain tab water, I have to activate this thing at least 3 times. After 3 times, I measured the heat with my meat thermometer and sure enough, it was still only 140F. Water boils at 212F. In between each cycle, I have to wait a minute, because it will not let me activate the on button for a little while. It's pretty frustrating to say the least. I would not buy again, it's cheap plastic and works poorly.
customer_reviews.author: caramelcream

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Product!
customer_reviews.text: We needed a kettle for quick use during the cold days when we need to heat up some water to warm up our cups while the coffee is brewing! It didn't need to be too big as we already have one in the kitchen, this was for our upstairs getting water from the vanity sink. This was the perfect size for all of the above and more so, it is fast! We love it! If there more color choices, I probably would have preferred a different color. Nevertheless, it serves the purpose well!
customer_reviews.author: NatureLover

customer_reviews.title: Fast water boiler!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to boil water for my tea almost daily! It’s fast and really convenient to use. Zero complaints it does what it is supposed to do. What more can you want? Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Vrain

customer_reviews.title: I prefer the T-fal and LOVE the price
customer_reviews.text: I own two of these now -- one at home and one in our camper/trailer. Don't know how I ever lived without it. Before finding this T-fal pot, I spent at least 10 times this much on a "big name" model. I prefer the T-fal and LOVE the price! If you're on the fence, just buy it! It's one handy dandy pot!
customer_reviews.author: New England Reader

customer_reviews.title: Boil in 90 sec...Don't think so
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if I got a dud but this pot boils in 4 minutes. I actually timed it when I realized it was taking too long. My last pot this one replaced did boil in 90 seconds and I loved it. For the price, it needs to do what the ad says. I'd return it but with Covid 19 who knows how long it would take to replace.
customer_reviews.author: 46&lovinit

customer_reviews.title: So great I had to buy another one
customer_reviews.text: I have had the T-fal electric kettle in my home for a couple of years. I liked it so much that when I was looking for one to use at work I bought another. I have had no problems with it and to clean out the lime buildup I just put a little vinegar in a cold kettle and let is set over night. I highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: John B Rinaldi

customer_reviews.title: Cordless, no coil inside, stainless bottom and multiple temp settings worth a few bucks extra
customer_reviews.text: I really like this water kettle and plan to use it to make coffee or tea while traveling since it is pretty lightweight. With a Melitta cone & filter it makes a very good cup of coffee. I really like the fact that it has a stainless inside bottom and no coil. Easy to take to sink fill up with water and not have to unplug from the wall. I think it was worth paying a little more for the cordless design, no coils inside and multiple temperature settings. Heats up very fast.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: though the temperature adjustment is rudimentary at best. It's ok if you simply want tea that ...
customer_reviews.text: Works, though the temperature adjustment is rudimentary at best. It's ok if you simply want tea that hasn't come to a boil but don't care if it's +/- 15 degrees from one heating to another, even if you don't touch the adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Dependable
customer_reviews.text: Have owned this tea kettle over 2 years now. Still works like day 1. I even use it when boiling big pots of water. I put a bit of water in pot, start the flame, then use this tea kettle until the pot is filled to where I need it and bam.... fast pot of boiling water. Worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Melody G

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite kitchen gadgets.
customer_reviews.text: I love this water boiler. I literally use it every single day for tea and boiling water for noodles, soup, etc. It heats up water so much faster than the stove and doesn't smell like burning plastic. I always fill the water above the line just a little and it hasn't done any damage since I've been using it for a year now. The only downside is it does rust and you can't see the rust so you should definitely wipe it every other night with a paper towel or microfiber cloth to prevent build up.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse
customer_reviews.text: I use this at least once daily, usually multiple times a day. I can't say I'm the most sensitive to temperature control-I mostly use it on full blast unless I'm making green tea, and more often then not I have it heat to the highest temperature and wait a few minutes to cool. Honestly I'm surprised it has lasted me this long, as we have bought much nicer ones for the office that get comparable use and they have died in under 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Greenfield

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, worried about the spout
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this 3 stars because I feel like the T-Fal engineers could have seen this failure mechanism a 1000 miles away. I have only been using this for 3 days and the plastic spout is falling apart. Aside from that the heater is working very well so far. I am just concerned that this plastic spout might be a design flaw and possibly a health hazard because it is plastic and looks like it can't handle the warm water coming out of it. Buy at your own risk I guess (until they change it)
customer_reviews.author: Nabid

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Love this teapot! Helped me stop drinking coffee! Better for you tooDrink more tea. This teapot heats up faster than a big ol’coffee pot
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Temperature feature fails, so the kettle fails.
customer_reviews.text: Variable temperature feature does not work on mine. It appears to support two temperature choices: 180 F, 190 F, 212 F. Also, it will produce remarkably different temperatures for any given knob setting at different times. Cheaper kettles are available without the temperature feature; you'll probably need to spend more to get one with a working temperature control.
customer_reviews.author: Charles C. Hardin

customer_reviews.title: Heats up fast, tempeture settings are hotter than discribed
customer_reviews.text: Works great, so far. My only issue is the settings aren't exactly accurate. I make loose leaf, green tea a lot. The setting for green tea, according to the manual, is the center setting. Way too hot for green. I had to turn it all the way down to keep it in the 175 degree range. So, in summary, works great, but check the temp with a thermometer. I did a few test runs with a thermometer before I ever used the water.
customer_reviews.author: Tucker385

customer_reviews.title: Nice adjustable (yet a bit small) electric kettle
customer_reviews.text: Use this for my tea. Love the temperature dial. Once I figured out where on the dial equaled about what temp, I could use it for white, green and black teas no problem. Bit small for my preference (two 12-14oz cups tea about empties it) but that just means my tea's ready that much faster. Have another kettle of about 1L capacity, but it only does full boil and takes several (4-6) minutes from cold.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

product_meta.title: T-fal C76220 Specialty Stainless Steel Dishwasher Safe Whistling Coffee and Tea Kettle, 3-Quart, Silver
product_meta.description: Style Name:Stainless Steel Stovetop Kettle| Color:SilverT-fal makes enjoying a cup of tea an easier and even more delightful experience with the 3 quart polished stainless steel kettle. The T-fal Stainless Steel 3-qt Tea Kettle is covered by a Lifetime Limited Warranty.
